pages.raw_output:
<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 208]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 216, 356, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2 (P2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 259, 460, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 320, 390, 337]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 351, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 368, 722, 383]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 325, 399]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 400, 497, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 447, 284, 462]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 463, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 494, 590, 509]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 510, 606, 526]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 540, 606, 555]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 556, 756, 572]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 572, 440, 587]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 588, 907, 619]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 432, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the inequality \(|2x + 1|< |2x - 5|.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 918, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 127, 97, 146]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 119, 920, 166]]<|/det|>
The curve with equation \(y = \frac{\sin 2x}{\mathrm{e}^{2x}}\) has one stationary point in the interval \(0\leqslant x\leqslant \frac{1}{2}\pi\). Find the exact \(x\)-coordinate of this point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 147, 920, 165]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 194, 97, 212]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 192, 584, 212]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(x^{4} - 4x^{3} + 3x^{2} + 4x - 4\) is denoted by \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[124, 225, 146, 243]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 225, 586, 244]]<|/det|>
Find the quotient when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x^{2} - 3x + 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 225, 918, 244]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 256, 151, 275]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 256, 437, 275]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 256, 920, 275]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 303, 92, 320]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[324, 311, 707, 485]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 504, 690, 524]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the part of the curve \(y = \sqrt{(2 - \sin x)}\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{2}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 536, 151, 555]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 536, 660, 555]]<|/det|>
Use the trapezium rule with 2 intervals to estimate the value of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 560, 578, 600]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi}\sqrt{(2 - \sin x)}\mathrm{d}x,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 605, 536, 625]]<|/det|>
giving your answer correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 605, 920, 624]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 637, 153, 655]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 636, 880, 655]]<|/det|>
The line \(y = x\) intersects the curve \(y = \sqrt{(2 - \sin x)}\) at the point \(P\). Use the iterative formula

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 662, 578, 682]]<|/det|>
\[x_{n + 1} = \sqrt{(2 - \sin x_n)}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 688, 920, 723]]<|/det|>
to determine the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 705, 920, 724]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[336, 83, 695, 260]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 279, 920, 330]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(y = A(b^{- x})\), where \(A\) and \(b\) are constants. The graph of \(\ln y\) against \(x\) is a straight line passing through the points (1, 2.9) and (3.5, 1.4), as shown in the diagram. Find the values of \(A\) and \(b\), correct to 2 decimal places. [6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 361, 101, 381]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 359, 143, 381]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 358, 288, 384]]<|/det|>
Find \(\int 4\mathrm{e}^{-\frac{1}{2}x}\mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 363, 920, 381]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 410, 146, 428]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 401, 416, 448]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\int_{1}^{3}\frac{6}{3x - 1}\mathrm{d}x = \ln 16.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 413, 920, 432]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 473, 96, 492]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 472, 329, 492]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 491, 594, 512]]<|/det|>
\[3x^{2} - 4xy + 2y^{2} - 6 = 0.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 532, 153, 551]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 528, 361, 560]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{3x - 2y}{2x - 2y}.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 536, 920, 555]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 574, 151, 592]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 573, 920, 593]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of each of the points on the curve where the tangent is parallel to the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 590, 920, 609]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 635, 96, 654]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 635, 146, 654]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 635, 665, 654]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\tan A = t\) and \(\tan (A + B) = 4\), find \(\tan B\) in terms of \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 635, 920, 654]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 666, 146, 685]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 666, 311, 685]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 686, 593, 705]]<|/det|>
\[2\tan (45^{\circ} - x) = 3\tan x,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 708, 544, 728]]<|/det|>
giving all solutions in the interval \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 710, 920, 728]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]
